<center>
IUCN Status: **Near Threatened**

EPBC Threat Rating: **High/Very High**

IUCN Claim: *'Predation by feral cats may also be a threat.''*

</center>

### Studies in support

Cats hunt dunnarts (Stokeld et al. 2016).

### Studies not in support

No studies

### Is the threat claim evidence-based?

There are no studies linking cats to Kakadu dunnarts.
<br>
<br>

![](assets/figures/Main_Evidence_Cat_Sminthopsis bindi.png)

### References

Stokeld, Danielle, et al. "Experimental evaluation of the role of feral cat predation in the decline of small mammals in Kakadu National Park." NT Department of Land Resource Management, Berrimah (2016).

Wallach et al. 2023 In Submission
